RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 94. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MOORE'S LAW settled just off the inside at the tail of the field through the first turn and down the backstretch, was in behind a trio of rivals stacked across the track into the far turn remaining just off the inside until coming under coaxing near the five-sixteenths, tipped out three wide nudging BREES to the four path and advanced, swung four wide into upper stretch, closed well outside to collar the embattled top pair forty yards from the finish and prevailed edging away at the end. MOUNT CRAIG coaxed from the gate, established the front and showed the way in hand along the inside through the first turn and down the backstretch coming under some pressure from HERO'S MEDAL midway, came under light coaxing tipped to the two path half a mile from home and had HERO'S MEDAL intensify the pressure advancing to engage in head to head combat three furlongs from home, widened away as a pair from the rest of the field and spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in stubbornly clinging to command trading light bumps and brushes through to the sixteenth marker, got caught in tandem with his main rival with forty yards to the finish, fought on to preserve the place honors. HERO'S MEDAL stumbled at the start, raced just off the inside in closest aim of the leader before advancing to latch on outside that rival with nine-sixteenths to go, went three wide through the far turn advancing to duel with MOUNT CRAIG to his inside, swung three wide into upper stretch, dug in dueling through to the finish getting overtaken in concert with his main foe forty yards from the finish, battled on but was ultimately bested for the place honors while well clear of the rest. GAME KEEPER stumbled at the start, chased along the inside coming under coaxing half a mile from home, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and tired. BRAGGADOCIOUS four then three wide through the first turn, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and tired. BREES coaxed from the start, raced three wide through the first turn, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch and faltered in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Mount Craig
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins,coaxed 2p 1/2, 2w 1/4, dueled str, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Game Keeper
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased ins, coaxed 1/2p, inside 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Hero's Medal
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, 2p in aim, advanced 3/8, 3w uppr, dueled str, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Moore's Law
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p at rear, nudged foes 3w 5/16, 4w uppr, closed well, up late

ENTRY.NAME: Brees
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 3w 1st turn, chased 4-3w, 3w upper, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Braggadocious
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w 1st turn, chased 3-2w, coaxed 7/16, 2w 1/4p, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 85. Allowance Purse 95000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIMELY CONQUEST went to the front, showed the way under pressure to her outside, vied in the two path on the turn, spun four wide into the stretch then drifted further out while moving clear, responded well after switching to the proper lead outside the furlong marker and drew off under steady urging. MISSING FORTUNE broke out at the start, stalked the pace on the outside, engaged the leaders leaving the backstretch, vied in the four path on the turn, came six wide into the stretch then lost touch with the winner, chased outside into the final furlong and proved no match while clear for the place. TOSCONOVA BEAUTY showed early speed, pressed the pace down the backstretch, vied between foes in the three path on the turn, passed the five-sixteenths pole under extra left-rein pressure, spun five wide into the stretch, chased while remaining on her inside lead into the final furlong and weakened but held the show. BIG BEAN CHRISTINE settled on the outside, was roused four wide on the turn, came seven wide into the stretch under the crop and lacked the needed response. CHASING DAYLIGHT moved up to establish a good position just off the pace, dropped back under urging while along the rail on the turn, turned into the stretch in the two path and also lacked the needed response. RANTING broke a step slow then was taken up, settled outside at the rear, moved in late on the backstretch, saved ground while roused early on the turn then angled to the four path, continued four wide into the stretch and failed to rally. LAVON was taken in hand early then dropped back between horses while rated, went three wide under urging early on the turn, dropped to the rail late on that bend and came up empty. BIG HAZEL was sent hard from the start then ridden along off the pace, rounded the turn in the two path, spun three wide into the stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Chasing Daylight
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed,dropped back rail turn,2path1/4,lckd needed response

ENTRY.NAME: Timely Conquest
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,2p trn,4p1/4,drft out3/16,drw away,stdy urging

ENTRY.NAME: Big Hazel
ENTRY.OWNER: Donk David G Carlson Dustin and Bernard Albert W
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent hard,urged along,2path turn,3path1/4,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Tosconova Beauty
ENTRY.OWNER: Dixon Linda K and Alejandro Hector M
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,btwn foes 3path turn,left-rein pressure,5w1/4,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Ranting
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,tkn up,at rear,mvd in 1/2,ins-4w turn,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Lavon
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand,rated,drop back btwn,3path-ins turn,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Big Bean Christine
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled outside,roused 4w turn,7w into lane,lacked needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: Missing Fortune
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,stlkd outside,bid7/16,4p turn,6p1/4,no match,clear2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 3 1 1/8M Inner turf CR: 94. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 162500. INNER TURF (PURSE $125,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $28,275 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 THREE TIMES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR W HICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $80,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $80,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KALIFORNIA QUEEN (GER) was placed to a light hold past the stands the initial time settling at the tail of the field while just off the inside through the first turn and down the backstretch, tipped three wide at the three-eighths, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued three wide into upper stretch, closed well outside through the final furlong to collar her barn mate in the final strides to the finish. ROCKY SKY (IRE) established the front and showed the way under a rating hold along the inside, remained patiently handled until set down taking the inside route into upper stretch, edged away under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in and was caught in the late stages while clear for the place honors. POCA MUCHA tossed her head and lunged at the gate at the start getting away last but conceding only a length or so, tracked the front while rated along the inside and was patiently handled until placed to light coaxing at the three-eighths after being very briefly taken in hand inside of CANISY, got called upon in earnest taking the inside route into upper stretch, kept on to the finish. CANISY tracked just off the inside under a rating hold, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Rocky Sky (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, set down ins 1/4p, edged away, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Poca Mucha
ENTRY.OWNER: Pantofel Stable Wachtel Stable and Zaro Jerold L
ENTRY.COMMENT: tossed head, lunged st, rated ins, let out inside 1/4, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Kalifornia Queen (GER)
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb Michael Madaket Stables LLC First Row Partners and Caruso Michael J
ENTRY.COMMENT: light hold 2p, coaxed 3w 5/16, 3w upper, closed, up last jumps

ENTRY.NAME: Canisy
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 2p, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Union Avenue H. SARATOGA RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 105. Stakes Purse 125000. A HANDICAP FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $125 ea ch which should accompany the nomination; $625 to pass the entry box and an additional $625 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $625 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the publi cation of weights. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, July 29, 2023 w ith 9 Original Nominations and 1 Supplement.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GRANNYS CONNECTION broke in then was hustled to the front, showed the way with a clear advantage, went around the turn in the two then three path, spun four wide into the stretch, remained clear under a strong hand-ride into the final furlong, was put to a right-handed crop outside the sixteenth-pole and held under steady urging. KANT HURRY LOVE showed speed then chased the pace, went three then four wide on the turn, came five wide into the stretch, pursued the winner under a drive in into the final sixteenth and finished willingly for the place. BANK ON ANNA chased the pace on the outside, went four then five wide on the turn, was driven six wide into the stretch and lacked the needed kick while clear for the show. VALLELUJAH dropped back under urging while showing no speed, went around the turn in the three path, turned into upper stretch under a drive and failed to threaten. TEMPERMENTAL was urged along while dropping well off the pace, saved ground on the turn and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Grannys Connection
ENTRY.OWNER: Orpen Horses LLC Towell Jr Jack Hardin and Griffin Alan
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in,hustled,clear pace,2-3p turn,4p1/4,responded,held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Tempermental
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along,well back,inside turn,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Vallelujah
ENTRY.OWNER: East Ave Racing Stable and Sisu Racing Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed,urged along,3path turn,failed to threaten

ENTRY.NAME: Kant Hurry Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed,chased,3-4path turn,pursued winner,willingly for place

ENTRY.NAME: Bank On Anna
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,4-5path turn,6p into lane,lacked needed kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 5 5 1/2F Turf CR: 94. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 156000. (PURSE $120,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $27,144 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment D ue At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GAL IN A RUSH chased just off the inside down the backstretch and then along the inside through the turn coming under coaxing five-sixteenths from home, angled out five wide into upper stretch, rallied with a rush to overhaul the leader a furlong from home, then edged clear to the finish kept to task. LADY MILAGRO established the front and showed the way in hand along the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole before being let out swinging three wide into upper stretch, drifted in straightened away and came under a left handed crop coming back out to the two path and forcing BREEZE EASY to alter inwards when overthrown by the top one at the eighth pole, ran on to preserve the place honors on the wire. BOWL OF CHERRIES chased just off the inside, got set down angled four wide into upper stretch, dug in and was in tight briefly between foes a furlong out as LADY MILAGRO came out under a left handed crop, ran on but was ultimately bested for the place honors. BREEZE EASY (GB) got away to an awkward start conceding two lengths to the front, chased just off the inside down the backstretch and then along the inside through the turn coming under coaxing with five-sixteenths to go, swung three wide into upper stretch before drifting slightly in to the two path straightened away, got taken in hand briefly and altered in briefly when LADY MILAGRO came out from along the inside under a left handed crop, then altered out in the late stages while weakening to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Bowl of Cherries
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, set down 4w upper, bid tight betw 1/8, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Gal in a Rush
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds Larsen Chris and Titletown Racing Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, ins turn, coaxed 5/16, 5w uppr, up 1/8, edged clear

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Tom & Mary Lou Teal & Adena Springs

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Milagro
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand ins, coaxed near 1/4, 3w upper, collared 1/8, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Breeze Easy (GB)
ENTRY.OWNER: R A Hill Stable and Reeves Thoroughbred Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward st, chased 2p, ins turn, 3w uppr, altered 1/8, wknd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 109. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 162500. (PURSE $125,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $28,275 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 THREE TIMES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 20 23 OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $80,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $80,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MARSALIS bumped with a rival at the start then was hustled, chased the pace on the outside, made a bid late on the backstretch, vied in the three path on the turn, took the advantage inside the three-eighths, inched clear in upper stretch, responded well under a drive in the final furlong and held under strong urging. COLONEL BOWMAN bumped with a foe at the start and was last to commence then hustled, was taken in hand briefly near the eleven-sixteenths then came back under urging, went around the turn in the two path, was driven three wide into the stretch, rallied while still on his inside lead into the final furlong, moved out while gaining at the sixteenth-pole and closed well to get the place. PROVOCATEUR pressed the pace on the outside of the leader, chased in the two path on the turn, shifted four wide at the quarter-pole, pursued the winner under a drive into the final sixteenth and lost the place while clear for the show. NIGHT TIME broke near the back of the field, was urged along off the pace, moved from three to five wide on the turn, came six wide into the stretch and improved position but lacked the needed response. TODAY'S FLAVOR stumbled at the start then was hustled to the lead, set the pace under pressure to his outside, vied along the rail on the turn, lost the advantage to the winner inside the three-eighths, dropped back in upper stretch and tired. ROTKNEE chased the pace on the outside then four wide on the turn, was driven five wide into the stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened. CLEM LABINE was ridden along towards the rear on the far outside, went three to four wide on the turn, came seven wide into the stretch and was no factor. DOT'S DOLLAR was coaxed along off the pace, saved ground under stronger encouragement on the turn, turned into the stretch in the two path and failed to rally.

ENTRY.NAME: Colonel Bowman
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmp st,last awy,in hand5-1/2,urgd,2p trn,rally,mvd out1/16,up2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Clem Labine
ENTRY.OWNER: Winning Move Stable, Sanford H. Robbins LLC and Jacobson, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: ridden along outside,3-4w turn,7w into lane,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Dot's Dollar
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed along, inside turn, 2path into lane, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Night Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk near back,3-5wide turn,6w into lane,improved,lckd needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: Today's Flavor
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled brk,set pressured pace,ins turn,headed ins3/8,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Provocateur
ENTRY.OWNER: McMahon Joseph G McMahon Anne and McMahon Michael J
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed outside,chased 2path turn,4p1/4,pursued winner,lost 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Marsalis
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,hustled,chsd,bid7/16,3p,lead ins3/8,responded,held

ENTRY.NAME: Rotknee
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside, 4path turn, 5wide into lane, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRUST FUND got bumped askew at the start by INONIT due to pressure from CATALINA CRUSH, who veered inwards, vied three to four paths off the inside briefly with a pair before emerging to duel three wide with PERLIANO to his inside through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive kept to task. CANIGETALOAN chased early on with a pair to the outside while along the rail, then chased through the turn along the fence coming under coaxing with five-sixteenths to run, swung three wide into upper stretch and ran on to secure the place honors tussling through to the finish with CATALINA CRUSH. CATALINA CRUSH veered in at the start bumping INONIT into the rear of TRUST FUND, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung six wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive drifting in requiring correction a sixteenth out, ran on to be just bested for the place honors while clear for the show. VETTRIANO chased five then four wide coming under coaxing and offering a bid with five-sixteenths remaining, swung four to five wide into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. PERLIANO hustled from the gate, vied briefly between foes from the two path before emerging to duel from the two path through the turn under coaxing three furlongs from home, continued just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened in the final furlong. BLUE EIGHTY FIVE broke in at the start getting corrected and taken in hand before making contact with PERLIANO, chased three wide coaxed along from the half mile pole, angled five wide into upper stretch and made no headway. INONIT got bumped solidly by CATALINA CRUSH into the rear end of TRUST FUND and got squeezed out and back between foes, chased along the inside under coaxing from the half mile pole, cut the corner into upper stretch and offered no response. DRINKING SOLO hustled from the start, chased along the inside coaxed along from the get go in range early on, began to retreat into the turn and tipped to the two path through that bend, continued just off the inside into upper stretch and tired. MAD BANKER broke on top in the initial jumps from the gate and then backtracked to the rear of the field six paths off the inside down the backstretch and then four wide through the turn under coaxing from the half mile pole, swung three wide into upper stretch and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Drinking Solo
ENTRY.OWNER: America's Pastime Stables Dubb Michael and Falcone Jr Robert N
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, coaxed along ins, 2p turn, 2w 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Canigetaloan
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied early ins, chased ins turn, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Perliano
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, vied 2p briefly, duel turn, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Blue Eighty Five
ENTRY.OWNER: LRE Racing LLC and JEH Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, chased 3w, coaxed 1/2, angled 5w upper, no headway

ENTRY.NAME: Trust Fund
ENTRY.OWNER: Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners and Repole Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, vied briefly 3-4w, duel 3w turn, 3-4w uppr, edged clr

ENTRY.NAME: Inonit
ENTRY.OWNER: The Estate of Richard J Lugovich
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped solidly, squeezed st, chased ins, cut corner, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Catalina Crush
ENTRY.COMMENT: veer in st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 5/16, 6w uppr, drift 1/16, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Mad Banker
ENTRY.COMMENT: 6w backstretch, 4w turn, coaxed 1/2p, 3w upper, trailed

ENTRY.NAME: Vettriano
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, bid coaxed 5/16, 4-5w upper, wknd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: National Museum of Racing Hall of Fame S. - Grade2 SARATOGA RACE 8 1M Inner turf CR: 105. Stakes Purse 500000. INNER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CARL SPACKLER (IRE) brushed with a rival at the start, saved ground on the first turn, settled off the rail on the backstretch, went around the far turn in the two path, was roused five wide into the stretch, brushed with an opponent near the three-sixteenths, rallied outside while drifting in twice in the stretch, closed well to get the lead outside the sixteenth-pole then moved clear under good handling. APPRAISE (IRE) went to the front, traveled around the opening bend in the two path, set a joint pace on the inside of a rival, was eased back outside the half-mile pole, ranged up in the two path to make a bid again now outside the leader near the five-sixteenths, spun three wide into the stretch, battled under a drive into the final sixteenth and was outfinished while just able to get the place. MORE THAN LOOKS broke out then brushed the gate and was slowest into stride, came out behind eager foes while pulling on the bit nearing the first turn, went three wide on that bend, settled outside on the backstretch, went four wide on the far turn, came six wide into the stretch, chased outside into the final furlong and finished willingly to just miss the place while clear for the show. OCEAN VISION (IRE) played up during the warm-up, brushed with a foe at the start, was taken up while keen early then dropped back under tight restraint, rounded the first turn in the two path, was reserved off the pace, came under urging while inside on the far turn, moved into a good striking position before the quarter-pole, turned into the stretch in the two path, chased on his left-lead into the final furlong, came between foes while still on the incorrect lead at the sixteenth-pole and was out-kicked. BEHIND ENEMY LINES (GB) brushed with opponents at the start, was keen under snug restraint into the first turn, saved ground while rated off the pace, ranged up on the far turn, was asked with a clear inside opening at the quarter-pole, made a bid inside a foe into upper stretch, had the hole tighten as that foe leaned in, brushed the hedge while pausing in tight quarters inside the three-sixteenths, chased into the final furlong and weakened. MISCHIEVOUS ANGEL went around the opening bend in the two path, was reserved off the pace, went three then two wide on the far turn, shifted four wide into the stretch, raced between rivals near the three-sixteenths and lacked the needed response. MYSTERIOUS NIGHT (IRE) was taken up off heels at the start, dragged his way forward between foes under a tight hold, went three wide on the first turn, set a joint pace on the outside, moved clear with a half-mile to run, dropped from the two path to the rail on the far turn, lost the advantage into upper stretch, leaned in under extra right-rein pressure inside the three-sixteenths and gave way. BAT FLIP was caught five wide on the first turn, settled outside towards the front, was given his cue in the three path on the far turn, swung five wide into the stretch and failed to rally. GENERAL JIM raced in the four path on the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside, was asked in the three path on the far turn, spun four wide into the stretch, brushed with a foe while dropping back near the three-sixteenths and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: More Than Looks
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,brshd gate,slow to stride,3p1st,out,4w2nd,6w1/4,willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Carl Spackler (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins1st,settled 2p,swung5w1/4,brshd 3/16,drift in,rally,up1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Behind Enemy Lines (GB)
ENTRY.OWNER: Rockingham Ranch Talla Racing and David A Bernsen LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: keen,ratd ins,open room1/4,hole tightnd,brshd hedge,pause,outkckd

ENTRY.NAME: Ocean Vision (IRE)

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of LCH

ENTRY.COMMENT: keen early,tkn up,drp bck,2p-ins,2p1/4,left lead,btwn1/16,outkckd

ENTRY.NAME: Appraise (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: to front,2p1st,pace ins foe,eased back1/2,2p2nd,bid,3w1/4,outkckd

ENTRY.NAME: Mysterious Night (IRE)

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of ASC

ENTRY.COMMENT: tkn up brk,drag forward,3p1st,out pace,clr1/2,2p-ins2nd,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Mischievous Angel
ENTRY.OWNER: Brant Peter M and Parkland Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,reserved,3-2p2nd t'urn,4p1/4,btwn3/16,lacked needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: General Jim
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4p1st,stalked outside,ask 3p2nd turn,4p1/4,brushed3/16,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Bat Flip
ENTRY.OWNER: Harrell Ventures LLC and Starlight Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w1st,settled outside,ask 3w2nd turn,5w1/4,no rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Evan Shipman H. SARATOGA RACE 9 1M Dirt CR: 103. Stakes Purse 125000. A HANDICAP FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $125 each which should ac company the nomination; $625 to pass the entry box and an additional $625 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $625 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the publication of weights. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, July 29, 2023 with 14 Nominations .
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DR ARDITO two to three wide in pursuit, floated out three to four wide with nine-sixteenths to go before tucking back to the three path placed to coaxing half a mile from home, made steady progress through the far turn and went four wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and was herded out five paths by the drifting out AMERICANREVOLUTION to the eighth pole, got directed in two paths inside that station issuing a challenge to take command seventy yards from the finish and edged away in the late going to score. SHERIFF BIANCO established the front after the start nearing the backstretch and showed the way in hand three then two wide, tucked inside half a mile from home, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and took the inside route into upper stretch roused for the drive, edged clear under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in and was caught with seventy yards to the finish while clear for the place honors. BANKIT forwardly placed along the inside, got forced to steady and alter to the three path when BARESE tucked directly in front with five and a half furlongs to run, then got forced four wide by that same rival soon after, tucked back to the two path into the far turn and came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, angled three wide into upper stretch, followed the pair in front of him outwards five paths to the furlong grounds before coming again mildly to secure the show honors. AMERICANREVOLUTION stumbled at the start conceding three to four lengths to the front before settling into stride at the tail of the field early on, went three to four paths off the inside down the backstretch and was carried out slightly with five and a half furlongs to run when BANKIT altered out from BARESE and then had the same foe tip out running more interference, tucked three wide into the far turn and advanced on the front tucking to the two path placed to coaxing at the five-sixteenths and forcing BARESE to the inside, swung three wide into upper stretch under a drive, drifted out five paths straightened away to the eighth pole and weakened to the finish. BARESE forwardly placed just off the inside in the early stages, tucked inside directly in front of BANKIT forcing that foe to steady and alter off the rail to the three path with five and a half furlongs to run, tipped out to the three path forcing all but the leader to alter out, tucked to chase just off the inside through the far turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, got nudged inside with five-sixteenths to go and took the inside route into upper stretch, then weakened through to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Americanrevolution
ENTRY.OWNER: CHC Inc and WinStar Farm LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, 3w pursuit, coaxed 2p 5/16, 3w uppr, drifted, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Dr Ardito
ENTRY.OWNER: Caruso Michael J and Dubb Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, coaxed 1/2p, 4w uppr, herded out, up final 70yds

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Fred W. Hertrich lll & John D. Fielding

ENTRY.NAME: Bankit
ENTRY.OWNER: Winchell Thoroughbreds LLC and Willis Horton Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, steady, alter 5 1/2, 2p 7/16, 3w uppr, came again

ENTRY.NAME: Barese
ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp and Staudacher David
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed 2p, impeded foe 5 1/2, ins 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Sheriff Bianco
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 3-2w, to ins 1/2, roused ins 1/4, clear, caught fin 70yds

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 10 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 50000. (UP TO $8,700 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $35,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAGNILOQUENT broke fast then rocketed clear of the rest of the field, opened up a sizable advantage in the three path on the turn, spun four wide into the stretch, maintained a very large advantage with the rider motionless in the saddle into the final furlong, was shaken up for a few strides shortly thereafter then put back to a very mild hand ride to win handily. LINARITE stumbled at the start and was off slow, angled in at the rear near the nine-sixteenths, dropped from the two path to the rail on the turn, turned into the stretch in the two path, angled out near the three-sixteenths and safely secured the place while no match for the winner. DIAMOND COLLECTOR was urged along off the pace, moved in leaving the backstretch, went around the turn in the two path, turned into upper stretch under a drive and lacked the needed response while able to get the show. QUICK POWER NAP broke out and bumped with a rival, was urged along on the outside, went five wide on the turn and also lacked the needed response then missed the show. SERENADE SOLDIER was hustled from the gate, chased the solo leader from second, traveled around the turn in the four path and tired. THREE UNIONS broke awkwardly then bumped with foes on both sides and was taken up while in tight between horses, angled in at the rear, saved ground on the turn and was no factor. KREESA LA WROTE bumped with a rival after the start, was urged along on the outside, went four then three wide on the turn, moved out in upper stretch and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Magniloquent
ENTRY.COMMENT: sped clear,opened up,3p turn,4p1/4,drew off,handily

ENTRY.NAME: Serenade Soldier
ENTRY.OWNER: McGuire Matthew T Hoover Michael L Rulapaugh Jr Terry Wayne and McGuire James Wa
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,chased solo leader,4path turn,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Diamond Collector
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along,moved in 1/2,2path trn,lacked needed response,earn3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Quick Power Nap
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,bmpd,urged outside,5wide turn,missed show

ENTRY.NAME: Three Unions
ENTRY.OWNER: Clear Stars Stable and Mitre Box Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward brk,bmpd btwn,tkn up,mvd in at rear,ins turn,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Kreesa La Wrote
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd after brk,urged outside,4-3path turn,mvd out,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Linarite
ENTRY.OWNER: Punk, Jr., William J. and DiLeo, Philip
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled brk,off slow,angled in,2p-ins turn,2p1/4,angld out,up2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 11 1M Dirt CR: 87. Claiming Purse 50000. INNER TURF (UP TO $8,700 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $35,000 (1.5% Afte rcare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SICILIAN GRANDMA chased just off the inside through the opening dog legged turn before tipping three to four paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked to the two path into the far turn advancing on the leader to take over command seven-sixteenths from home, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths under challenge to the outside, swung two to three wide into upper stretch displaced from the front, came again to take command nearing the eighth pole, then edged clear to the finish kept to task. SWEETEST PRINCESS three wide through the opening bend, chased five paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking three wide into the far turn advanced on the front coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took over the front and swung five wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and was collared nearing the eighth pole ran on to chase the aforementioned foe home clear of the rest for the place honors. GHOSTLY GIRL established the front midway on the first turn when HUNTRESS MOON was taken hold of and eased off, showed the way in hand just off the inside before tucking inside half a mile from home, got displaced from the front with seven-sixteenths to go, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun two to three wide into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. ANILEATE just off the inside through the first bend, raced six to seven paths off the inside into the backstretch before tucking to the two path carrying HUNTRESS MOON inside of her to near the rail before clearing that rival five furlongs from home, came under coaxing two to three wide at the three-eighths, angled four to five wide into upper stretch and tired. HUNTRESS MOON stumbled at the start and broke on top despite it, was taken hold and throttled back off the front midway on the first turn along the rail conceding the spot to GHOSTLY GIRL, tipped out five to six paths off the inside into the backstretch, got carried in by the aforementioned foe to nearly the rail near the five furlong marker before being cleared by that rival, went four wide into and through the far turn under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, swung four to five wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Huntress Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumble st, 5-6w early, carried 2p 5/8, 4w 7/16, 4-5w uppr, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Ghostly Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: C&H Diamond Racing LLC Fowler Barry Breffni Farm and Magdalena Racing (Sherri Mc
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, to ins 1/2, yielded 7/16, 2-3w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Sicilian Grandma
ENTRY.OWNER: Caruso Michael J and Dubb Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-4w, to 2p 1/2, up 7/16, 2-3w uppr, up 1/8, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Anileate
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p 1st turn, 6-7w early, coaxed 2-3w 3/8, 4-5w uppr, tired
